sections.title: Access Control & Authentication
sections.note: Verify policies and technical controls for user access.
items: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is required for all remote access to the network.
MFA is enforced for all privileged user accounts (administrators).
MFA is enforced for all cloud-based services (Email, File Storage, etc.).
A strong password policy is documented and enforced via technical controls.
Access reviews are performed at least quarterly to remove stale accounts.

sections.title: Endpoint & Network Security
sections.note: Confirm deployment and configuration of security software.
items: Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) or Managed EDR (MDR) is deployed on all servers and workstations.
A managed, business-class firewall is in place with active security subscriptions.
Network traffic is segmented to isolate critical systems.
Email filtering solution is in place to block spam, phishing, and malicious attachments.

sections.title: Backup & Recovery
items: Critical data is backed up daily to a secure, off-site, or immutable location.
Backups are encrypted both in transit and at rest.
Full recovery tests are performed at least annually.
Backup systems are isolated from the primary network to protect against ransomware.

sections.title: Patching & Vulnerability Management
items: A formal patch management process is in place for operating systems and third-party applications.
Critical security patches are applied within 30 days of release.
Regular vulnerability scanning (at least quarterly) is performed on internal and external assets.
